patterns: What separator size do I need?
responses: Flow rate is the most important factor in determining separator size
All JK ENGINEERING Separators operate within a prescribed flow range
smaller than the existing piping

patterns: I want to raise a complaint
there is a complaint about a service
responses: Please provide us your complaint in order to assist you
Please mention your complaint, we will reach you and sorry for any inconvenience caused

patterns: What is the factory timer setting of the Auto Purge Controller?
What is the factory timer setting
timer setting of the Auto Purge Controller
responses: JK ENGINEERING factory-built purge controllers do not have factory-set timings.
The required purge frequency and durations vary depending on flow rates, solids concentrations, type of solids
Purge often at first and calculate the proper rate based on the expected volume of separated solids.
Purge duration should be long enough to evacuate the purge chamber AND clear the entire length of the purge piping of all solids.
This is usually indicated by a change in the color of the purged liquid from dark to light
The time between purges should never exceed the time it takes to fill 1/3 of the collection chamber volume

patterns: How long will the separator last?
responses: While there are many JK ENGINEERING Separators still in service after 15-25 years
It can generally be expected to last as long as any other materials of similar construction in that system.
Environment, fluid chemical make-up, flow, the material of construction, type of solids, and maintenance purging are all important factors to the life of a separator.

patterns: What size media do I need ?
What size media do I need in a sand media filter?
responses: Media filtration sand requirements are based on the filter’s downstream equipment needs.
#20 Filter Sand 200 – 250 mesh (74-63 microns) #16 Filter Sand 150 – 200 mesh (105-74 microns) #12 Filter Sand 120 – 150 mesh (125-105 microns)

patterns: What is the efficiency of the separator?
can you tell me about seprator efficiency?
responses: Solids-removal efficiency is affected by several factors, including the difference in specific gravity between the solids and the carrying liquid
Appreciable quantities of particles finer than 74 microns are also removed, as well as particles of lighter specific gravity.
Higher specific gravities (like mill scale in water, where SG=5.7) result in much finer levels of filtration.

patterns: How often should I backwash a sand media filter?
gap between backwash of sand media filter
responses: It is recommended that backwashing should take place at an interval when it is anticipated the filter system will have a 7 psi pressure drop.
If the filter media does not achieve 7psi differential over 24 hours, it is recommended that the filter be backwashed once a day as a minimum.
Yes, we can manufacture a separator with a Canadian Registration Number (CRN).
Yes,We must know the Province or Territory the vessel is to be located so we can contact the registration controlling agency within that Province or Territory to determine the cost and lead time.

patterns: Where does the sand go when operating a Pump Protection Separator ?
Sand place in Pump Protection Separator?
where does sand go in PPS?
responses: The sand goes to the bottom of the well. Over time, the flow dynamics of the well formation are changed due to the accumulation of the sand, and water is pumped without disruption through the life of the well.
Standard maximum pressure rating for most JK ENGINEERING Separators is 150 psi. The exceptions are the SMP Separators, which have a maximum pressure rating of 100 psi.
Standard maximum temperature rating for operating most JK ENGINEERING Separators is 180°F. The exceptions are SMP Separators, which have a maximum temperature of 120°F.

patterns: Will the separator work on fluid other than water?
will separator work on different fluid?
will separator work with different fluid and solid particles?
responses: The JK ENGINEERING Separator is capable of working with any liquid that has a viscosity less than 100 SSU.
The greater the specific gravity of the separable solids and the lower the viscosity of the liquid, the better the JK ENGINEERING Separator will work.
A good rule of thumb: if the solids settle within 3-4 minutes in your liquid, they will likely be separable with a JK ENGINEERING Separator.

patterns: What is the greatest solids load the separator can handle?
How much solid load separator can handle?
responses: The maximum solids loading on JK ENGINEERING Separators is recommended to be less than 1% by volume.SMP Separators for residential use are not recommended to exceed 0.25% by volume.

patterns: What material of construction is available for a separator?
responses: As a standard, most separators are available in mild carbon steel and 304L/316L-series stainless steels. In special cases, separators can also be fabricated in plastic or fiberglass.

patterns: How do I determine what I need for basin sweeping in HVAC systems?
what do i need in basin sweeping in HVAC systems ?
responses: As a rule of thumb, JK ENGINEERING uses a sizing factor of 1 GPM per square foot of basin area to determine the required size of a Tower Clean (TC) system
